summary: This document contains an affidavit by Daniel Reller, a Compliance Security Analyst at AT&T, verifying the authenticity of AT&T records related to Jeffrey Epstein. It includes details about the records provided, their format, and the practices followed by AT&T in maintaining such records. This document contains detailed records of voice usage and call activity associated with Jeffrey E. Epstein's AT&T Wireless account. It includes timestamps, call durations, and locations for numerous incoming and outgoing calls, primarily in New York and other locations. The document is significant as it provides insight into Epstein's communication patterns during a critical period. This document contains detailed records of voice usage and call activity associated with Jeffrey E. Epstein's AT&T Wireless account. It lists numerous incoming and outgoing calls, primarily to and from locations in New York, Palm Beach, and other areas, along with associated charges and descriptions of services used. This document details the voice usage and charges associated with Jeffrey E. Epstein's AT&T wireless account. It includes records of incoming and outgoing calls, their durations, and associated charges, primarily from locations in New York and Palm Beach. The document provides insights into Epstein's communication patterns during this period. This document appears to be a continuation of a report detailing current activity, specifically focusing on text and multimedia message usage. It includes a summary of messages sent and received, but lacks specific names or events related to the Epstein case.

connections.description: Daniel Reller, as the Compliance Security Analyst and Custodian of Records, verifies the records associated with Jeffrey Epstein's account.
Andrew Rohrbach is mentioned as an analyst who works with Daniel Reller at AT&T.

events.title: Email of Records
events.description: Andrew Rohrbach emailed the AT&T records to the Global Legal Demand Center.

events.title: Record Keeping Practices
events.description: The affidavit discusses the regular practices of AT&T in maintaining records, specifically in 2006.

locations: 11760 US Highway 1, Suite 300, North Palm Beach, FL 33408
keyFacts: Daniel Reller is the Compliance Security Analyst and Custodian of Records for AT&T.
The affidavit verifies the authenticity of AT&T records related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The records were emailed to the Global Legal Demand Center on September 30, 2021.
The affidavit states that the records were made in accordance with AT&T's regular business practices.
The document details voice usage for Jeffrey E. Epstein's AT&T Wireless account.
It includes numerous call records from April 9 to April 16, 2004, primarily involving locations in New York.
The account was active during a critical time, with multiple incoming and outgoing calls logged.
The document indicates various call durations and types, including incoming and outgoing calls.
There are references to charges associated with the calls, indicating the financial aspect of Epstein's communication.
The document details voice usage for Jeffrey E. Epstein's AT&T Wireless account, including numerous calls made and received.
Calls are primarily logged from various locations in New York and Florida.
The document includes charges for services such as message retrieval and call waiting.
The account activity spans multiple days in April 2004, with specific timestamps for each call.
The document indicates a pattern of frequent communication, particularly with New York locations.
The document contains detailed records of voice usage for Jeffrey E. Epstein's AT&T wireless account.
Calls were made primarily from New York and Palm Beach, with various incoming and outgoing calls recorded.
The document includes charges for voice usage, including roaming charges while in different locations.
There are multiple instances of message retrieval noted in the call records.
The document indicates a pattern of communication that includes numerous calls during early evening hours.
